Bug.Summery: NamingConvention: Tests fail
Bug.WithStack:
20030122
I changed our tests to use NamingConvention. There are failuers, please check.
NameProposerTest in jdt.ui.tests Martin - can you confirm that the problem is actually in the NamingConvention, and not in the test itself? yes, it's showing the difference between our old NameProposer and the new NamingConvention.
- prefixed ending with a letter (e.g. f) should only be removed if the following caracter of the name if a capital letter (e.g. fCount -> count foo -> foo) (m_color -> color)
- if a field begins with is, special handling for getter/setter isBlue -> isBlue -> setBlue && isBlue
There are bug reports for this (rules for bean attributes) What is the rule if 'isBlue' is not a boolean ? for non- boolean, get/set must be used. For boolean it can be is/set but also get/set is fine. Important is that when cut the get/set or is/set, the rest is the same.
class X { int isBlue; int setGreen; boolean getRed; }
Suggested getter and setter should be: getBlue/setBlue or getIsBlue/setIsBlue ? getGreen/setGreen or getSetGreen/setSetGreen ? isRed/setRed or isGetRed/setGetRed ?
What part of the field name must be remove to compute getter/setter name ? i would say it is getIsBlue/setIsBlue getSetGreen/setSetGreen isGetRed/setGetRed
the only exception is for boolean isXX, because using 'is' for a boolean seems to be a common pattern and isIsXX is really ugly. to use isXX or setXX for e.g. an int is of course possible too, but doesn't make too much sense to me.
API Change in org.eclipse.jdt.core.NamingConventions: a new boolean parameter 'isBoolean' added. The value of this parameter is true if the field's type is boolean. suggestSetterName(IJavaProject,char[],int,char[][]) become suggestSetterName(IJavaProject,char[],int,boolean,char[][])
suggestSetterName(IJavaProject,String,int,String[]) become suggestSetterName(IJavaProject,String,int,boolean,String
Fixed. Verified.

Bug.Summery: Improving the creation of the build time construction
Bug.WithStack:
At build time, a Site is being used representing both the code to compile and the code to compile against (installed base).
Because the code to compile against never change, whereas the code to compile might evolve (dynamic creation of feature for example), it might be interesting to provide a system of cache to avoid parsing again the installed base. This has been improved in the code available from HEAD. This is fixed
Bug.WithOutStack:
At build time, a Site is being used representing both the code to compile and the code to compile against (installed base).
Because the code to compile against never change, whereas the code to compile might evolve (dynamic creation of feature for example), it might be interesting to provide a system of cache to avoid parsing again the installed base. This has been improved in the code available from HEAD. This is fixed

Bug.Summery: Drag & Drop not implemented on the Mac

Lines.Line: - enable DND between applications, currently disabled until interaction with
- enable drag under effects for Table and Tree
It has been 6 months since the last update of this request. Are we still
waiting on "interaction with Finder can be made safe"?
- dragging items from Eclipse to other applications (with the exception of the Finder) seems
to work well on Panther (our only supported Platform for 3.0).
- as already found by Eric, dragging items to the Finder works only if the DragSource
contains a TextTransfer (in addition to a FileTransfer).
- I don't know what problems comment #9 is referring to ("disabled until interaction
with Finder can be made safe"), however I couldn't find any problems.

Bug.WithStack:
We should try to do this for 2.2. *** Bug 23960 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** I do not understand why you created a new bug for this, and closed the older one as a duplicate. The older one had a number of people -- including myself -- on the CC list for this bug.
Later bugs are normally closed as the duplicate, and not the earlier ones. I made a mistake. *** Bug 35071 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** NOTE: Drag & Drop is unrelated to the ability to drag views around in Eclipse. This has been implemented for 2.1.1 and 3.0.
Drag & Drop refers to classes in the package org.eclipse.swt.dnd and deals with dragging and dropping data between SWT and native apps, being a drop target or drag source none of which Eclipse is doing when you drag around a view in the IDE. Dragging Views around in eclipse is addressed by bug 28525 which has been fixed in 2.1.1 and 3.0. I would like to mention that it would already be very helpful if the DropTarget just generated the events (as the DragSource does). Veronika, didn't you implement this? If so, please close this PR. The DropTarget already generates events. They are not the same events as the DragSource - they are the events relevant to a dorp target.
See: http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-SWT-DND/DND-in-SWT.html
Most of DND has been implemented on the Mac (and ported back to 2.1.1).
The things that are still missing are: - enable DND between applications, currently disabled until interaction with Finder can be made safe - enable drag under effects for Table and Tree It has been 6 months since the last update of this request. Are we still waiting on "interaction with Finder can be made safe"?
I would really like to have the ability to drop to finder if at all possible. Eric, feel free to pitch in, browse the code and submit a patch. Ok...I enabled drag capabilities in the swt library and everything seems to work great. What interaction with the finder needs to be made safe? Andre, Veronika is gone right now. Do you know of the interaction that he's talking about? I mean "she's" of course ... A note on drag behavior to the finder...
on Panther 10.3.3 it seems that the Operating System needs to have TextTransfer supported for ANY drag to the finder. You just have to support the type and return a valid string when requested. (If you are transferring files it still needs this)
on 10.2.8 this is not required and actually always chooses text transfer if you support it. This is a problem since you might be wanting to actually transfer another type, like a file.
I special cased 10.3 and above to include the text transfer and every other OS and Mac version just include the Transfer type I want to transfer (files in my case). Not sure this will work in all cases but at least it provides some functionality for my users.
So, I hope this helps someone. Not sure if this is an Operating System bug or not but what a pain! Andre? I haven't looked into Drag&Drop to Finder under Panther yet. So, I do not have any more information about this. But I'll do a quick check... Eric, do you have any code (or patch) that I can try? Created attachment 8993 Test case for Drag to Finder
This simple text case shows the variance in behavior between OS X 10.3.3 and 10.2.8. You need to modify the sample code to point to some local file for dragging.
You will also need to enable the drag feature in the SWT library. Source File: org.eclipse.swt.dnd.DragSource.java Method signature: private void drag(Event); Eric, thanks for the snippet. I enabled external drags in SWT and used it both with your snippet and with Eclipse. Here is my conclusion: - dragging items from Eclipse to other applications (with the exception of the Finder) seems to work well on Panther (our only supported Platform for 3.0). - as already found by Eric, dragging items to the Finder works only if the DragSource contains a TextTransfer (in addition to a FileTransfer). - I don't know what problems comment #9 is referring to ("disabled until interaction with Finder can be made safe"), however I couldn't find any problems.
From these findings I suggest to start enabling the drag feature in the SWT library. The added functionality is useful and I see no risk involved even if interaction with the Finder does not work.
But I'm not so sure in how to deal with the additional TextTransfer required for FileTransfer drags to the Finder. I don't think that application should know about this MacOS implementation detail. A consequence would be that a FileTransfer includes TextTransfer too. But I don't know whether this is possible or desirable.
Let's enable it then. Veronika can check our work when she gets back. What's the state of DND support in Mac for SWT >= 3.0.52? Is it already possible to drag and drop items inside a SWT application from Tree to Tree and CTabItem to Tree?
Regards, ben Closing this bug as fixed in 3.0.
There are two outstanding issues which are tracked in bug 68212 and bug 68213.

The UI thread involves SWT only it seems. Moving to SWT. Are you really running 2.1 or is this 3.0? Not sure what to do about this. Since there is no lock around the OS on Windows, the SendMessage() should run right away so it isn't deadlock. The only thing I can think of is that there is an infinite loop in Windows under certain conditions.
Please reopen this bug report if you see it again.

Bug.Summery: Unix man pages for the Eclipse executable
Bug.WithStack:
John Murdie has contributed these man pages. They need to get into the product. Since SWT owns the Eclipse launcher (for some reason?), it's an SWT bugzilla report they should be maintained by the SWT team. Created attachment 3107 GTK man page Created attachment 3108 Motif man page Sonia, how do you want to procede? *** Bug 30106 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** adding Kevin H. to the discussion. More info from Kevin:
The contents of the man pages should reflect any on-line help that would be generated (e.g., eclipse -help). See bug # 25334.
The motif man file (man/man1/eclipse-motif.1) is really misnamed. It should be: man/man1/eclipse.1.
The actual man page contents are probably out of date. I am not sure whether the switches listed are still valid or whether they should even be documented. This is related to the on-line help mentioned above. Again, the contents should indicate ECLIPSE(1) and not ECLIPSE-MOTIF(1).
The -showsplash and -endsplash (which doesn't exist) switches should not be documented since they are private switches between the launcher and the Eclipse core.
If these man pages are to be shipped, then the main "eclipse" directory (where the launcher resides when installed) will need a "man/man1" directory (e.g. <installDir>/eclipse/man/man1) where the man page file will reside. The user will then have to add the top man directory to the existing MANPATH as follows:
/bin/sh: MANPATH=${MANPATH}:<installDir>/eclipse/man; export MANPATH /bin/csh: setenv MANPATH ${MANPATH}:<installDir>/eclipse/man
With a real product install, such as WebSphere Workbench, the install mechanism could put this man directory into a better location on disk. With Eclipse being shipped as a ZIP file, this is harder to do.
To add the man pages does not require a change to the launcher. This is really a build/install issue.
Moving to releng to consider. Can we revive this bug report? It would be really nice to ship some man pages with eclipse. Some Linux distributions (Red Hat and Debian, at least) are currently creating their own when they make packages. It would be helpful if we provided some for them to install which covered the command line options (much like how we ship an icon). The contributed man pages are obviously out of date :-)
Billy, given that you have contacts with several linux distros who generate man pages for their eclipse builds, do you know if they would be willing to donate them to the Eclipse project.
Man pages do not change that much and are usually quite rudimentary and refer to other documentation for further details, such as the online help. It might be sufficient to update man pages once a release cycle.
>The contributed man pages are obviously out of date :-) > >Billy, given that you have contacts with several linux distros who generate man >pages for their eclipse builds, do you know if they would be willing to donate >them to the Eclipse project. > >Man pages do not change that much and are usually quite rudimentary and refer >to other documentation for further details, such as the online help. It might >be sufficient to update man pages once a release cycle.
Yes, Unix manual pages are traditionally just 'quick reference cards' for the command, library or other entity they describe. They shouldn't really be longer than one printed page - if a command has many options, they should just mention the most-used ones. They're meant to refer the reader to the full user documentation and any related commands etc. I view them also as an index to the full documentation of a Unix (Linux, Solaris etc.) system.
(Some people delight in pointing out that the notation used for traditional Unix manual pages (troff procedural markup) is obsolescent, but that's not the point. Until someone comes along with a new widely-adopted standard, I'd rather stick to the old standard.)
If manual pages could be generated automatically from the full documentation, so much the better. Several things I've come across - e.g. the HOL/Z/etc formal methods proof editor/checker ProofPower - do that very successfully.
John A. Murdie Department of Computer Science University of York UK The issue with generating man pages with from the full documentation is that the the doc is 30MB zipped. Providing the full documentation in man format increase the size of the *nix drops by 30MB. Eclipse is large enough as it is :-)
I think that a simple man page that provided users with the commands they need to start eclipse and pointed them to the online help would be useful without significantly increasing the size of the drop. >The issue with generating man pages with from the full documentation is that >the the doc is 30MB zipped. Providing the full documentation in man format >increase the size of the *nix drops by 30MB. Eclipse is large enough as it >is :-)
I don't think you read my posting very carefully. :-)
>I think that a simple man page that provided users with the commands they need >to start eclipse and pointed them to the online help would be useful without >significantly increasing the size of the drop.
Which is pretty much what I said.
I think this matter is closed.
John A. Murdie Created attachment 17292 eclipse man page for RHEL This is an old bug and I don't think we will ever fix it since we don't package the eclipse linux drop, we just provide a tarball and this is will not change. Perhaps this could be covered by the linux distros project or the packaging project. Why don't we just put the man pages in the hairball? (In reply to comment #15) > Why don't we just put the man pages in the hairball? +1. Getting it there does not hurt at all, or will not make it any more hairy. I don't really see the benefit of including the man page with the Linux drops. The reason is that when the user extracts the drop the man page won't be in the correct place to be displayed when they type "man eclipse". But perhaps someone else could provide insight. (In reply to comment #17) > The reason is that when the user extracts the drop the man page won't be in the > correct place to be displayed when they type "man eclipse". But perhaps > someone else could provide insight.
You're right about the location. Could they perhaps just be in the src drops? Then we (the Linux distros) can put them into the right place in our packages? Andrew, please reopen this bug with patch to include it in our source drops if you are interested. *** Bug 291988 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

John Murdie has contributed these man pages. They need to get into the product. Bug.Summery: not clear what 'modifiers' in NamingConventions means
Bug.WithStack:
20030121 we have 2 classes for handling modifiers (or flags if you wish) Flags, and Modifier they both contain the same methods but it's not clear if they are compatible
so when NamingConventions.suggestGetter name has a parameter 'modifiers' i'm not sure what to feed it with Both are equivalent. The DOM one is actually a duplicate.
Both are implemented in term of the spec values (from the VM spec book), thus whichever constant you use should not make a difference.
I agree though it is confusing.
DOM Modifiers should redirect to Flags. Added clarifying comments to Flags, Modifiers, and NamingConventions. Verified.
Bug.WithOutStack:
20030121 we have 2 classes for handling modifiers (or flags if you wish) Flags, and Modifier they both contain the same methods but it's not clear if they are compatible
so when NamingConventions.suggestGetter name has a parameter 'modifiers' i'm not sure what to feed it with Both are equivalent. The DOM one is actually a duplicate.
Both are implemented in term of the spec values (from the VM spec book), thus whichever constant you use should not make a difference.
I agree though it is confusing.
DOM Modifiers should redirect to Flags. Added clarifying comments to Flags, Modifiers, and NamingConventions. Verified.

Bug.Summery: [resources] Recreating deleted project does not restore linked resources
Bug.WithStack:
build 20030121
-Create a linked folder in a project (simple or Java) -Delete the project but don't delete the project contents -Recreate the project ->You will see all the resources in the project except for the linked resources. The linked resources should be recreated as well. They still are in the .project file.
Aside: There was a report on the newsgroup indicating that linked resources were in fact recreated in this scenario. I could not reproduce the reported behavior.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 29634 ***
Bug.WithOutStack:
build 20030121
-Create a linked folder in a project (simple or Java) -Delete the project but don't delete the project contents -Recreate the project ->You will see all the resources in the project except for the linked resources. The linked resources should be recreated as well. They still are in the .project file.
Aside: There was a report on the newsgroup indicating that linked resources were in fact recreated in this scenario. I could not reproduce the reported behavior.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 29634 ***

Bug.Summery: NPE focus making invalid selection in dependencies view
Bug.WithStack:
Build: 200301221039
I'm getting an NPE when making an invalid selection in the Plug-in selection dialog opened from the Plug-in dependencies view.
Steps to reproduce: 1 - Open PDE Plug-in dependencies view 2 - Open the context menu and select "Focus on..." option 3 - Instead of selecting one of the listed plug-ins, select one of the groups (either "Workspace plug-ins" or "External plug-ins") 4 - Notice that the Ok button is still enabled. Click it. Result: nothing happens, and a NPE is logged (will attach). Created attachment 3109 Log excerpt Thanks for the catch. We added a line that disables 'OK' button when the group objects are selected.
The fix will appear in the next build. In the mean time, just don't press 'OK' when these objects are selected :-).

Build: 200301221039
I'm getting an NPE when making an invalid selection in the Plug-in selection dialog opened from the Plug-in dependencies view.

Click it. Result: nothing happens, and a NPE is logged (will attach). Created attachment 3109 Log excerpt Thanks for the catch. We added a line that disables 'OK' button when the group objects are selected.
The fix will appear in the next build. In the mean time, just don't press 'OK' when these objects are selected :-).

Bug.Summery: Should schema include files be gen as html docs?
Bug.WithStack:
If a schema file was created for the sole purpose of being included into other schema files, when the html docs are generated, would it not be appropriate to not generate an html doc file for the "include" schema file (given that the content will be added to the schema file including it already)?
Right now, we get an html doc for schema files that only exist to be included in other schema files. I'm manually deleting these for the moment... The final solution we will use in Eclipse is to generate documentation using PDE Ant task, so docs will be generated during the build and you will not need to maintain local copies.
For now, you can rename schemas that are used just for inclusion to *.mxsd (don't forget to change the 'include' element as well). The builder only generates documentation for *.exsd files.
Ant task starts from the model, looks up 'schema' attribute in extension point elements and loads schema objects to generate docs. This means that included schemas will be loaded as part of the parent schema object creation. Since included schemas are not referenced directly in manifests, they will not appear in the reference docs.
Bug.WithOutStack:
If a schema file was created for the sole purpose of being included into other schema files, when the html docs are generated, would it not be appropriate to not generate an html doc file for the "include" schema file (given that the content will be added to the schema file including it already)?
Right now, we get an html doc for schema files that only exist to be included in other schema files. I'm manually deleting these for the moment... The final solution we will use in Eclipse is to generate documentation using PDE Ant task, so docs will be generated during the build and you will not need to maintain local copies.
For now, you can rename schemas that are used just for inclusion to *.mxsd (don't forget to change the 'include' element as well). The builder only generates documentation for *.exsd files.
Ant task starts from the model, looks up 'schema' attribute in extension point elements and loads schema objects to generate docs. This means that included schemas will be loaded as part of the parent schema object creation. Since included schemas are not referenced directly in manifests, they will not appear in the reference docs.

Bug.Summery: Delete key doesn't work after drag and drop from palette.
Bug.WithStack: After creating a new edit part using drag and drop from the palette, that newly created edit part is selected, but pressing the delete key doesn't delete it. During TemplateTransferDropTargetListener.handleDrop(), the newly created object is selected but the palette viewer's control remains in focus. When pressing the delete key immediately after the drop, the key handler that gets used is from the palette viewer. I remedied this by calling viewer.getControl().forceFocus() in TemplateTransferDropTargetListener.selectAddedObject(). This forces the graphical viewer's control to have focus.
Bug.WithOutStack: After creating a new edit part using drag and drop from the palette, that newly created edit part is selected, but pressing the delete key doesn't delete it. During TemplateTransferDropTargetListener.handleDrop(), the newly created object is selected but the palette viewer's control remains in focus. When pressing the delete key immediately after the drop, the key handler that gets used is from the palette viewer. I remedied this by calling viewer.getControl().forceFocus() in TemplateTransferDropTargetListener.selectAddedObject(). This forces the graphical viewer's control to have focus.

Bug.Summery: Can't change max/minOccurs for an included element
Bug.WithStack:
If I add an included element to a compositor, from the properties view, I cannot change the max/minOccurs properties. I can however, modify the source code directly. Right - that is because method 'getSchema()' for the element reference returns the schema from the actual referenced element that is in the included schema (which is read-only). I changed the implementation of 'getSchema()' to return the schema of the compositor (the grammer container of the reference). Since compositors always belong to the parent schema, the correct schema object is used to notify changes and to test for editable flag.
Tested and released.
Bug.WithOutStack:
If I add an included element to a compositor, from the properties view, I cannot change the max/minOccurs properties. I can however, modify the source code directly. Right - that is because method 'getSchema()' for the element reference returns the schema from the actual referenced element that is in the included schema (which is read-only). I changed the implementation of 'getSchema()' to return the schema of the compositor (the grammer container of the reference). Since compositors always belong to the parent schema, the correct schema object is used to notify changes and to test for editable flag.
Tested and released.

Bug.Summery: Marker type changes when using "Previous Search Results"
Bug.WithStack:
Eclipse 2.0 (build 200206271827)
I create markers of my own type using the same method as when searching Help pages:
ResourcesPlugin.getWorkspace().getRoot().createMarker("my.marker.id");
and then set its attributes the usual way and add it to the search result view. This all works and my "GotoMarkerAction" can recognize the custom type and retrieve from the marker attributes the information it needs to open the resource that marker is referring to (a URL).
However, when I use Search Results view's "Previous search results" button to go back to my search, although the matches are redisplayed and the attributes are still there on markers, the marker type is changed to "org.eclipse.search.searchmarker". This throws off my GotoMarkerAction, which relied on looking for a custom marker type.
Shouldn't the marker type be also restored in this case? It should. I will have a look tomorrow morning. OK, I see the problem: currently the Search infrastructure does not handle sub types of org.eclipse.search.searchmarker correctly in every case.
Good finding!
As a workaround, you could simply use the existing search marker type like all other Search clients (Java, NLS, Help) do - or does your marker inherit from more than one super type?
Fixed. Available in builds > N20030124
> As a workaround, you could simply use the existing search marker type like all > other Search clients (Java, NLS, Help) do - or does your marker inherit from > more than one super type?
No, it has only one supertype (search.searchmarker right now, although come to think of it, there really isn't any reason why it shouldn't be directly descendent from resources.marker). I was using the marker type so that other of my plugin's classes that may be passed a marker could tell what it is right away and know that certain attributes will be there for sure. > there really isn't any reason why it shouldn't be directly > descendent from resources.marker If you want your markers displayed in the Search result view your marker either has to inherit from org.eclipse.search.searchmarker or you use org.eclipse.search.searchmarker directly (i.e. create markers of that type). If you don't need to publish new attributes as API i.e. you only internally add new attributes then I suggest to use org.eclipse.search.searchmarker. This would fix your problem immediately and reduces the size of you plugin.xml.

Bug.Summery: Suggestion: how to simplify file diff'ing
Bug.WithStack:
I'd like to suggest that file diffing be implemented in the mode supported by CSDiff: http://www.componentsoftware.com/products/csdiff/ScrShots/sh02.htm
Please try it, and you will see that it makes comparing 2 different versions of a file much simpler and requires a lot less screen space. We had that mode of diffing in our previous product VAME, but usersliked the side by side mode better. The inline mode is good for small changes,but it doesn't work well for large changes.Will reconsider after 2.1 As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.
Bug.WithOutStack:

Bug.Summery: [Preferences] Autobuild pref to put errors in task list
Bug.WithStack:
It would be nice to have an option to place the errors autobuild has caught in the task list. (Just as the errors that a normal build produces are placed in the task list.) JBuilder does it like this, and I think that is the right way to go.
I find it visually straining and uninformative to look for little yellow and red boxes off to the side of my code, to see where there have been error detected. It would be better to be able to put large, informative notes about autobuild-detected errors in the task list.
Drawing a distinction between build errors (in the task list, and boxes off to the right) and autobuild errors (wavy underlines, and boxes off to the right) seems artificial and not helpful.
Just a thought though. There are currently no plans to work on this feature
Bug.WithOutStack:
It would be nice to have an option to place the errors autobuild has caught in the task list. (Just as the errors that a normal build produces are placed in the task list.) JBuilder does it like this, and I think that is the right way to go.
I find it visually straining and uninformative to look for little yellow and red boxes off to the side of my code, to see where there have been error detected. It would be better to be able to put large, informative notes about autobuild-detected errors in the task list.
Drawing a distinction between build errors (in the task list, and boxes off to the right) and autobuild errors (wavy underlines, and boxes off to the right) seems artificial and not helpful.
Just a thought though. There are currently no plans to work on this feature

Bug.Summery: Provide inforpops for launch configuration types
Bug.WithStack:
There is a need for a way to supply infopops for the launch configuration types as they are listed in the Launch Configuraiton Dialog and on the 'Debug As' menu.
If products ship a significant number of launch configurations, it might be very helpful for the customers to get a 'real' infopop with the links to the appropriate docs instead of just a simple tooltip. We would likely need to add optional "help context id" attributes to the launchShortcut and launchConfigurationTabGroup extension points. Since the mapping of shortcut to launch config type is not restricted to a 1:1 releationship (i.e. there can be multiple shortcuts for a launch config type), we must specify on a per shortcut basis.
Time permitting for 2.1 Done. Launch shortcuts now can specify help context ids. We need to get help content for the 2 Java launch shortcuts (local Java & applet).
Please verify, Darin W.
Verified.

There is a need for a way to supply infopops for the launch configuration types as they are listed in the Launch Configuraiton Dialog and on the 'Debug As' menu.

Bug.Summery: [variables] Variable view should remember expansion state of out-of-scope variables
Non-user friendly Javadoc URL preference
Bug.WithStack:
In preferences, under Java->Installed JREs, select a JRE and click Edit. If you enter a path in the Javadoc URL field (without a leading "file:/" and click OK, the dialog goes away without any errors, but the preference is not saved. Instead, it should see that you've entered a path and prepend the "file:/". Added URL syntax checking to "Add JRE" dialog. An error message is now displayed if the URL syntax is invalid.
Fixed. Please verify, Joe (S). Verified.
Bug.WithOutStack:
In preferences, under Java->Installed JREs, select a JRE and click Edit. If you enter a path in the Javadoc URL field (without a leading "file:/" and click OK, the dialog goes away without any errors, but the preference is not saved. Instead, it should see that you've entered a path and prepend the "file:/". Added URL syntax checking to "Add JRE" dialog. An error message is now displayed if the URL syntax is invalid.
Fixed. Please verify, Joe (S). Verified.

What version of Eclipse? Since M4, we have added progress reporting when a

Bug.WithStack:
When clicking OK after changing the Javadoc URL field for a JVM under Installed JREs, Eclipse takes a long time to do something while the UI is completely unresponsive (including screen paints) without so much as an hourglass pointer.
1. This should be sped up (if possible). 2. Eclipse should still paint itself. 3. User should get an hourglass pointer (minimum) or some sort of progress dialog. Not sure if this is us or Debug. This the page is owned by Debug I think they are resonsible to setup the operation the right way. Martin told me that setting the Javadoc location is fast. What version of Eclipse? Since M4, we have added progress reporting when a build takes place, and we have better "re-build" detection, such that we do not build when a source attachment or javadoc location changes.
I'm using 2.1 M4. Also, I've set it several times, and it takes a long time everytime (like 60-120 sec). It also doesn't seem to matter if the Javadoc is local or on the network.
BTW, the long pause is not when you close the "Edit JRE" dialog, but when you close the Preferences dialog. Please try with the latest build - these problems have been fixed. The problem seems to be fixed in I20030122.

Bug.Summery: [Dialogs] Default directory when clicking Browse buttons
Bug.WithStack: When Eclipse pops up a "Browse for folder" dialog when there is no starting folder, the dialog starts with "My Documents" selected. This is almost never what you want. More useful would be to either start in the directory last used by the dialog or start at "My Computer" with it expanded so you can see the drives (my vote is for #2). There are currently no plans to work on this feature

There are currently no plans to work on this feature

Bug.Summery: Need element changed events for attribute initializer, Javadoc changes
Bug.WithStack:
When a user changes an attribute initializer, or an element's JavaDoc in the Eclipse source editor, the events fired to registered IElementChangedListener do not have the details of the initializer and JavaDoc changes in the IJavaElementDelta.
The only data the IElementChangedListener receives is an IJavaElementDelta for the ICompilationUnit, with only the flags F_FINE_GRAINED and F_CONTENT, and no further nested IJavaElementDeltas. This data is insufficient to determine what exactly has changed in the source code.
It would be helpful if the IJavaElementDelta for the ICompilationUnit had a nested delta element for the IField in case of attribute initializer changes, and, for JavaDoc changes, a delta element for the element with the modified JavaDoc. The JavaModel currently has no knowledge of javadocs, and more generally any comment. Therefore, a javadoc change will not be reflected as a method change.
We may revisit this behavior post 2.1, and provide Javadoc manipulation APIs. Thanks, Philippe.
Does the Java Model also not keep track of attribute initializers? If it does, could events for attribute initializer changes be introduced? In addition to attribute initializers, and JavaDoc comments, there are no Java model events fired when method parameters' names are changed in the source code. As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.
Bug.WithOutStack:
When a user changes an attribute initializer, or an element's JavaDoc in the Eclipse source editor, the events fired to registered IElementChangedListener do not have the details of the initializer and JavaDoc changes in the IJavaElementDelta.
The only data the IElementChangedListener receives is an IJavaElementDelta for the ICompilationUnit, with only the flags F_FINE_GRAINED and F_CONTENT, and no further nested IJavaElementDeltas. This data is insufficient to determine what exactly has changed in the source code.
It would be helpful if the IJavaElementDelta for the ICompilationUnit had a nested delta element for the IField in case of attribute initializer changes, and, for JavaDoc changes, a delta element for the element with the modified JavaDoc. The JavaModel currently has no knowledge of javadocs, and more generally any comment. Therefore, a javadoc change will not be reflected as a method change.
We may revisit this behavior post 2.1, and provide Javadoc manipulation APIs. Thanks, Philippe.
Does the Java Model also not keep track of attribute initializers? If it does, could events for attribute initializer changes be introduced? In addition to attribute initializers, and JavaDoc comments, there are no Java model events fired when method parameters' names are changed in the source code. As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: DBCS: Lexial error during the indexing with the NLS language pack

Lines.Line: 2. Extract the NLS Language package (eclipse-nls-SDK-2.0.x.zip) under the same
5. Input DBCS characters in the search field and Go to the Search
During the indexing, the Lexical error are occurred.

Bug.WithStack:
Driver: I20030122 Java : IBM Java 1.3.1 SR-3 Platform : RedHat 8.0 ja_JP.eucjp locale
I got some errors at the consol during indexing when I used the NLS Language package.
Steps 1. Extract the eclipse-SDK.zip 2. Extract the NLS Language package (eclipse-nls-SDK-2.0.x.zip) under the same directory 3. launch the eclipse (./eclipse -vm /opt/IBMJava131/jre/bin/javaw) 4. Open the Help 5. Input DBCS characters in the search field and Go to the Search During the indexing, the Lexical error are occurred. Created attachment 3117 the error messages
Here is the error messages at the consol. The problem is valid. I have reproduced it with 2.1 buils, as well as with 2.0.2 build. The problem also exists on Windows, but the console is not normally displayed if eclipse launched from eclipse.exe
The documents seem correct, display fine. The character set is specified correctly, the docment is decoded, but the parser fails to parse them. The error alwasy occurs around the first character of the value of the alt attribute in the img element. I have tried zh_CN locale and documents. The same problem appears. Adding an option UNICODE_INPUT = true; to the file org.apache.lucene.demo.html.HTMLParser.jj, regenerating the parser and recompling it fixes the problem.
However, currently we do not modify or build Lucene in Eclipse. The libraries are downloaded from Apache and used as is.
If this bug is left unfixed, any document that contains DBCS characters in attributes is only indexed until that attribute. After the error, the rest of the file is ignored. The search results also do not list all hits that should be found. Some documents are ommited from results as they were not fully indexed.
This is a second bug, in addition to bug 20935, that exists in the Lucene demo parser and requires that we alter apache code and rebuild, or find a different parser to use in help. Fixed, by changing and recompiling lucene HTMLParser. Verified successfully with I20030206 driver. Though, I got another error, so I will open a new defect.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Driver: I20030122 Java : IBM Java 1.3.1 SR-3 Platform : RedHat 8.0 ja_JP.eucjp locale
I got some errors at the consol during indexing when I used the NLS Language package.
Steps 1. Extract the eclipse-SDK.zip 2. Extract the NLS Language package (eclipse-nls-SDK-2.0.x.zip) under the same directory 3. launch the eclipse (./eclipse -vm /opt/IBMJava131/jre/bin/javaw) 4. Open the Help 5. Input DBCS characters in the search field and Go to the Search During the indexing, the Lexical error are occurred. Created attachment 3117 the error messages
Here is the error messages at the consol. The problem is valid. I have reproduced it with 2.1 buils, as well as with 2.0.2 build. The problem also exists on Windows, but the console is not normally displayed if eclipse launched from eclipse.exe
The documents seem correct, display fine. The character set is specified correctly, the docment is decoded, but the parser fails to parse them. The error alwasy occurs around the first character of the value of the alt attribute in the img element. I have tried zh_CN locale and documents. The same problem appears. Adding an option UNICODE_INPUT = true; to the file org.apache.lucene.demo.html.HTMLParser.jj, regenerating the parser and recompling it fixes the problem.
However, currently we do not modify or build Lucene in Eclipse. The libraries are downloaded from Apache and used as is.
If this bug is left unfixed, any document that contains DBCS characters in attributes is only indexed until that attribute. After the error, the rest of the file is ignored. The search results also do not list all hits that should be found. Some documents are ommited from results as they were not fully indexed.
This is a second bug, in addition to bug 20935, that exists in the Lucene demo parser and requires that we alter apache code and rebuild, or find a different parser to use in help. Fixed, by changing and recompiling lucene HTMLParser. Verified successfully with I20030206 driver. Though, I got another error, so I will open a new defect.

Bug.Summery: Unable to launch with -Xbootclasspath/p:
Bug.WithStack:
AFAIK the tab bootstrap in the launcher doesn't allow me to use the given classes as prefix which is necessary for using e.g. visibroker with jdk 1.4. Correct, we do not support the prefix option. You must provide a complete bootpath.
As a workaround, can you just use the default entries in the list, and then add you entries before the default entries? yup. works :-). Marking as later, to consider post 2.1 (i.e. feature of prefixing bootpath) Having the custom entries before the default entries doesn't work anymore (using Build 200303071024 (RC2)). Please provide more details - what does your classpath/bootpath look like, and what is the corresponding command line that we generate (visible from the properties of the associated debug target/process in the debug view)? It seems like Eclipse ignores the defined variables added to the xbootclasspath. I defined vbjorb.jar, lm.jar, and vbsec.jar to be in the first positions in the xbootclasspath, but apparently they don't appear. This is necessary for Visibroker to work, since we must not use the JDK ORB. Here the generated output, I added a return after each jar in order to increase readability:
T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\bin\javaw.exe -Xbootclasspath:T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\rt.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\sunrsasign.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\jsse.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\jce.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\charsets.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\ext\dnsns.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\ext\ldapsec.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\ext\sunjce_provider.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\ext\localedata.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\rt.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\sunrsasign.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\jsse.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\jce.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\charsets.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\ext\dnsns.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\ext\ldapsec.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\ext\sunjce_provider.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\ext\localedata.jar; T:\Programme\Cobra.basti\current; T:\Programme\Cobra.basti\current\cobraLibrary\interceptorHandler\classes -classpath ... What variables are on the bootpath, and do they appear with correct values in the "classpath variables" preference page? Created attachment 4172 Screenshot of XBootClasspath
here's a screenshot of my xbootclasspath settings Created attachment 4173 Screenshot of classpath variables preference the paths to the jars are correct, btw. I can reproduce the problem. It appears the variable entries are appearing on the classpath rather than the bootpath - do you see the entries on the "- classpath" portion of the command line? yep... first entries after -classpath. If you need my classpath as well, I could provide it... I should be able to determine the problem now that I can reproduce it. Marking as RC3 candidate, CC'ing EG for approval. thx :-). yes Fixed. The "classpath property" of the variable entries were not being propogated to the resolved entries. Noted that we had the same problem for projects with multiple (non-default) output locations on the bootpath.
Added cartesian product of tests (21) to ClasspathProviderTests: (USER_CLASSES | BOOTPATH_CLASSES | STANDARD_CLASSES) * (variable | extended variable | project | folder | archive | multi-output project | container) Please verify, Joe. Verified.
Fixed for me as well. Everything works :-)). Thanks again.

T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\bin\javaw.exe -Xbootclasspath:T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\rt.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\sunrsasign.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\jsse.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\jce.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\charsets.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\ext\dnsns.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\ext\ldapsec.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\ext\sunjce_provider.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\ext\localedata.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\rt.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\sunrsasign.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\jsse.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\jce.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\charsets.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\ext\dnsns.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\ext\ldapsec.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\ext\sunjce_provider.jar; T:\programs\current\standardLibrary\sun\jdk1.4.0.1\jre\lib\ext\localedata.jar; T:\Programme\Cobra.basti\current; T:\Programme\Cobra.basti\current\cobraLibrary\interceptorHandler\classes -classpath ... What variables are on the bootpath, and do they appear with correct values in the "classpath variables" preference page? Created attachment 4172 Screenshot of XBootClasspath
here's a screenshot of my xbootclasspath settings Created attachment 4173 Screenshot of classpath variables preference the paths to the jars are correct, btw. I can reproduce the problem. It appears the variable entries are appearing on the classpath rather than the bootpath - do you see the entries on the "- classpath" portion of the command line? yep... first entries after -classpath. If you need my classpath as well, I could provide it... I should be able to determine the problem now that I can reproduce it. Marking as RC3 candidate, CC'ing EG for approval. thx :-). yes Fixed. The "classpath property" of the variable entries were not being propogated to the resolved entries. Noted that we had the same problem for projects with multiple (non-default) output locations on the bootpath.
Added cartesian product of tests (21) to ClasspathProviderTests: (USER_CLASSES | BOOTPATH_CLASSES | STANDARD_CLASSES) * (variable | extended variable | project | folder | archive | multi-output project | container) Please verify, Joe. Verified.
Fixed for me as well. Everything works :-)). Thanks again.

Bug.Summery: Display custom perspective on startup
Bug.WithStack:
Given an eclipse plugin that defines a custom perspective, we need a mechanism to make Eclipse start up with this perspective opened by default, without the user having to open the perspective manually.
Currently, we're modifying the UI (org.eclipse.ui) plugin's workbench.xml file to persuade Eclipse to open our custom perspective on startup, but a cleaner way to do this would be great. Moving to Update/Intall for comment. If you are shipping your own Eclipse-based product, you can change the default values for the preferences (in this case, you want to change the default perspective preference).
Read about it in the 2.0 online help (here is the link):
http://dev.eclipse.org:8080/help/content/help:/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/guid e/product_config.htm
Bug.WithOutStack:
Given an eclipse plugin that defines a custom perspective, we need a mechanism to make Eclipse start up with this perspective opened by default, without the user having to open the perspective manually.
Currently, we're modifying the UI (org.eclipse.ui) plugin's workbench.xml file to persuade Eclipse to open our custom perspective on startup, but a cleaner way to do this would be great. Moving to Update/Intall for comment. If you are shipping your own Eclipse-based product, you can change the default values for the preferences (in this case, you want to change the default perspective preference).
Read about it in the 2.0 online help (here is the link):
http://dev.eclipse.org:8080/help/content/help:/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/guid e/product_config.htm

Bug.Summery: [performance] leverage IResourceProxyVisitor
Bug.WithStack:
The new IResourceProxyVisitor results in signficant speed-ups when processing the resource trees as long as you do not need the full path of the resource.
The AmountOfWorkCalculator is a candidate for leveraging the new IResourceProxyVisitor. Please investigate. This was already on my list ;-) Increasing to P2.
Core Comments from eclipse-dev:
In today's integration build (20030114), there is new API in the org.eclipse.core.resources plugin for performing optimized traversals of resource trees. The optimization works by avoiding the creation of transient Path and IResource handles during the traversal of tree elements that you are not interested in visiting. Instead, the visitor is given a resource proxy, from which various information can be obtained without any garbage being created. The new API entry point is:
IResource.accept(IResourceProxyVisitor, int).
If you currently use IResourceVisitor, you should switch to the new API if any of the following is true:
- your visitor is not interested in every resource in the subtree being visited (for example, you only care about folders, files ending in .xml, derived resources, etc.).
- your visitor only needs the simple resource name, or other simple information that is available from the resource proxy.
- your visitor is interested in the full resource path, but doesn't need access to the resource handle
If you don't already use IResourceVisitor, but you currently traverse significant subtrees using IContainer.members(), you may also benefit from switching to this new API. One great example is code that traverses a subtree to count the number of resources in order to initialize a progress monitor (for example the method #countChildrenOf in most ExportOperation classes). Some other spots that could see huge performance gains are LaunchManager.searchForFiles and SearchForBuildFilesDialog.searchForBuildFiles).
We are switching to use this visitor internally in the resources plugin, and we have seen speed improvements up to 22x over the old visitor implementation in the best case. In the worst case, this visitor is still as fast as the old visitor, although slightly less convenient to use due to the extra indirection of the proxy. From glancing through the senders of the old accept method, it looks like most existing resource visitors can take advantage of this. If you have further questions, please send them to the platform-core-dev mailing list.
Eclipse Platform Core Team Search now uses IResourceProxy and IResourceProxyVisitor. Available in builds > N20030207
Note: The elelements from the scope are not proxies since all the dialogs (e.g. working set dialog from platform UI) return resources and there's not API to create a proxy.
Bug.WithOutStack:
The new IResourceProxyVisitor results in signficant speed-ups when processing the resource trees as long as you do not need the full path of the resource.
The AmountOfWorkCalculator is a candidate for leveraging the new IResourceProxyVisitor. Please investigate. This was already on my list ;-) Increasing to P2.

Bug.Summery: [View Mgmt] Perspective: permit stacking custom view above existing view
Bug.WithStack:
In a plugin's plugin.xml, we can define a perspective extension where custom views can be stacked with existing views. However, it is not possible to change the stacking order, so that the custom view appears above the existing view.
An additional attribute for the view element, to set the stacking order would be good to have, so that, for example, we could write:
<perspectiveExtension targetID="..."> <view relative="org.eclipse.ui.views.TaskList" relationship="stack" visible="true" id="com.xyz.myview" stackorder="1"/> </perspectiveExtension> There are currently no plans to work on this feature
Bug.WithOutStack:
In a plugin's plugin.xml, we can define a perspective extension where custom views can be stacked with existing views. However, it is not possible to change the stacking order, so that the custom view appears above the existing view.
An additional attribute for the view element, to set the stacking order would be good to have, so that, for example, we could write:
<perspectiveExtension targetID="..."> <view relative="org.eclipse.ui.views.TaskList" relationship="stack" visible="true" id="com.xyz.myview" stackorder="1"/> </perspectiveExtension> There are currently no plans to work on this feature

Bug.Summery: Extract local: Usage should be more comfortable [refactoring]

Lines.Line: 0-length is problematic: which expression do i take?
i agree though that less ui would be better here (in-place)
question is what to do with the 'replace all?' question that appears in the
dialog? sometimes that's what you want, sometimes not
I think we should try to support 0-length when it is clear which expression to
take. I was tricked by this as well. Can't we come up with something here ?
usually you would position the cursor at the beginning of the expression you

Bug.WithStack:
20030122
To use the 'extract local' refactoring, you have to first select the full expression, which takes as much time than doing a cut. It also shows a dialog for the name.
Better would be if is can be used on a 0-length cursor (e.g. at the beginning of an expression), and if the name would be guessed (and maybe the linked rename mode is enabled) the name is guessed if the expression ends in a call to a getter
field.foo().bar().getFred() -> guessed name is fred
0-length is problematic: which expression do i take? i agree though that less ui would be better here (in-place) question is what to do with the 'replace all?' question that appears in the dialog? sometimes that's what you want, sometimes not I think we should try to support 0-length when it is clear which expression to take. I was tricked by this as well. Can't we come up with something here ? usually you would position the cursor at the beginning of the expression you want to extract.
Name guessing is usually done with the type to which the expression resolves.
If you detect more places of the same expression ('replace all') you could bring an extra dialog. Maybe its the best to make a quick assist for this, so you would see the the preview But for 2.1 we will not convert it into a quick assist. Sine we don't have a satisfying stroy for refactorings and quick assist we shouldn't start converting singel refactorings. Additionally with the new short cuts it's faster to open the refactoring directly than using quick assist. extract method fails too and extract constant
so, how 'bout we postpone it now and fix then for all 3? defer to be investigated We should at least solve the 0-length case for extract local and constant for M3. I will take care about extract method. 0-length selection is now handled as if the covering node were selected

20030122

Bug.Summery: Eclipse should remember selected element in parent scope when browsing [browsing]
Bug.WithStack:
Scenario: In the Java browsing perspective, select a project, package, type and member of the type. Also select some text in the editor. Now browse to a different project. The browse back to the first project. Eclipse will now have forgotten which package, type and member was selected. The text selection will also be forgotten.
It would be very convenient if, for every element (on each level of the project-package-type-member-text hierarchy) Eclipse could remember the selection. This is the way we (fondly) remember VAJ did it.
The current behaviour is especially annoying when you use the hierarchical layout of the Packages view, since the hierarchy collapses (this is a bug in itself, the expansion state should be remembered, see 28990). In fact, these two issues together makes the hierarchical layout of doubtful value. This will not make it in for 2.1. Postponing As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Scenario: In the Java browsing perspective, select a project, package, type and member of the type. Also select some text in the editor. Now browse to a different project. The browse back to the first project. Eclipse will now have forgotten which package, type and member was selected. The text selection will also be forgotten.
It would be very convenient if, for every element (on each level of the project-package-type-member-text hierarchy) Eclipse could remember the selection. This is the way we (fondly) remember VAJ did it.
The current behaviour is especially annoying when you use the hierarchical layout of the Packages view, since the hierarchy collapses (this is a bug in itself, the expansion state should be remembered, see 28990). In fact, these two issues together makes the hierarchical layout of doubtful value. This will not make it in for 2.1. Postponing As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Found 1 deadlock. Philippe's scenario looks like a variant of bug 28671 (we don't have deadlock, but a huge number of messages being processed by the UI thread prevents a synchronous runnable to get executed).
Here, again, the refresh local operation has already finished but, differently than the other case, the *progress monitor* is blocked waiting for a chance to have a runnable executed by the UI thread (it was one of the resource change listeners in the other bug).
Johan, your dump does not include any workspace operation being executed, and it seems it is related to class loading. Have you logged it only in this PR? Actually, it only saw it "deadlocking" 10 minutes <g>, I killed it at that point... could have just taken an enormous amount of time. i also reported it under bug 31074 yes (where i believe it somehow a classloading thing)
So I recommend this bug to be marked as duplicate of bug 28671 (I do not have rights for doing it).
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 28671 ***

Found 1 deadlock. Philippe's scenario looks like a variant of bug 28671 (we don't have deadlock, but a huge number of messages being processed by the UI thread prevents a synchronous runnable to get executed).
Here, again, the refresh local operation has already finished but, differently than the other case, the *progress monitor* is blocked waiting for a chance to have a runnable executed by the UI thread (it was one of the resource change listeners in the other bug).
Johan, your dump does not include any workspace operation being executed, and it seems it is related to class loading. Have you logged it only in this PR? Actually, it only saw it "deadlocking" 10 minutes <g>, I killed it at that point... could have just taken an enormous amount of time. i also reported it under bug 31074 yes (where i believe it somehow a classloading thing)
So I recommend this bug to be marked as duplicate of bug 28671 (I do not have rights for doing it).
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 28671 ***

Bug.Summery: Show resources in Types View of Java Browsing [browsing]

Lines.Line: - replace the Projects view with the Package Explorer and set the filter to hide
- add the Navigator to the perspective

Bug.WithStack:
Java resources reside in the same name space as Java types, so it should be possible to view the in the same view (subject to filtering, of course).
I am aware that this (or similar) issue has been raised before, but I am not satisfied with the Package Explorer + Java type filter solution. The Package Explorer does not belong in the Java Browsing perspective it is half Projects, half Packages, and not good at either. Postponed > 2.1 Reopen to mark was wontfix. As the name indicates the Types view shows Java types. To edit resources in the Java Browsing perspective do one of the following: - use Ctrl+Shift+R - replace the Projects view with the Package Explorer and set the filter to hide the Java elements - add the Navigator to the perspective
So, change the name of the Types view. I want a view that satisfies the following: -Is coupled to the Projects + Packages view (just like Types is) and only shows what is in the selected package -shows types and (switchable) resources
Navigator/Package Explorer does not do this. Ctrl-shift-r does nothing for me. >Ctrl-shift-r does nothing for me. What do you mean? Does it not work? Note: this is a 2.1 feature. You can also open it using Navigate>Open Resource
Ah, ok. Now I see what it does. Not what I'm looking for either, sorry. (ctrl- shift-r only seems to be available if the Navigator has focus, btw) Should not be bound to the navigator. Works for me when the editor or another view is selected. Note: There might be views (most-likely views that are not part of the Eclipse SDK and that did not yet adapt to 2.1).

Bug.Summery: 2 fullbuilds performed in reaction to preference change
Bug.WithStack:
Build 20030122
If modifying in the same operation both compiler preferences and task tags, and accepting these changes, I will get prompted twice for performing a full build (the second occurs after the first full build did occur).
This looks pretty bad. We should fix this for 2.1 Fix is not easy. Downgraded priority per discussion with Philippe As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: [scrapbook] Stacktraces and other error messages get inserted into scrapbook

Lines.Line: - "An exception occurred during evaluation: java.lang.ArithmeticException" is appended next to the last line.
I think this bug's status should be CONFIRMED because it is still a problem IMO. If it there is a reason why this will not be fixed, please provided.

Bug.WithStack:
If there is an uncaught exception thrown, or if there is a compile error when evaluating the scrapbook, the error message gets inserted into the scrapbook. It felt a bit bizarre already in VAJ, and it feels even more bizarre that it has crept along into Eclipse. It is also quite annoying. Alerts/modal dialogs are also annoying but much less so.
Build: 2.1-M4 Nothing planned for 2.1 As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you. This bug is still valid in Eclipse Helios (3.6): - open a scrapbook page - add code: int a = 0; int b = 2/a; - select and execute the code - "An exception occurred during evaluation: java.lang.ArithmeticException" is appended next to the last line. I think this bug's status should be CONFIRMED because it is still a problem IMO. If it there is a reason why this will not be fixed, please provided.
I think the scrapbook should be split into two panes with all results including exceptions on the bottom pane. (In reply to Marius Kruger from comment #4) > I think this bug's status should be CONFIRMED because it is still a problem > IMO. If it there is a reason why this will not be fixed, please provided. >
Reopening.
> I think the scrapbook should be split into two panes with all results > including exceptions on the bottom pane.
Would you be willing to work on such a feature? Currently there is just not enough committer resources to work on this.

2. Create a Java project step by step

4. Bring up the context menu for the projet

OS: RedHat 8

Bug.Summery: [actions] "Add Javadoc comment" should augment preexisting comment
Bug.WithStack: Scenario: Select a method or type that already has a Javadoc comment and do Source>Add Javadoc comment. The element will now have two javadoc comments. While semantically correct, this is seldom desirable. "Add Javadoc comment" should detect the presence of an already existing javadoc comment and add any missing tags (e.g. if the signature of the method changed, or if there is a missing author tag or whatever). Given the current schedule we will have to live with this for 2.1. *** Bug 45351 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 65934 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 92512 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 92512 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** reopen *** Bug 211525 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 375791 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Bug.Summery: [syntax highlighting] Color code elements by scope
Bug.WithStack:
In Java you can declare local variables just about anywhere in the code. That makes it difficult to, at a glance, see if a variable is local, a parameter or a instance or static field of the class. Naming conventions are often imposed to remedy this. However, different shops have a habit adopting different naming conventions, and you are increasingly likely to use toolkits in source form from a number of different origins.
It would be helpful if it was possible to assign different colors to identifiers by their scope, so that e.g. fields and local variables would stand out as different in the editor. Available in builds > 20040423 (see preference page Java->Editor->Semantic Highlighting; will be integrated with the current Syntax Highlighting preference page).
Please close this bug.
.
Bug.WithOutStack:
In Java you can declare local variables just about anywhere in the code. That makes it difficult to, at a glance, see if a variable is local, a parameter or a instance or static field of the class. Naming conventions are often imposed to remedy this. It would be helpful if it was possible to assign different colors to identifiers by their scope, so that e.g. fields and local variables would stand out as different in the editor. Available in builds > 20040423 (see preference page Java->Editor->Semantic Highlighting; will be integrated with the current Syntax Highlighting preference page).
Please close this bug.
.

Bug.Summery: Default indentation goes wrong when Tabs are disabled
Bug.WithStack:
If I set "Indentation is represented by a tab" in Window-Preferences-Java-Code Formatter-Style, then when I press enter after the { in the code below (the dot represents the cursor position): if (something) {. the result is as expected, i.e: if (something) { . Howerver, if I do not set the above option (which is what I want), then I get: if (something) { . This is very annoying as I have to continually delete the extra spaces that are inserted. How the indentation looks depends on your settings. There are two settings: One that talks about the usage of tabs and the other one talking about how many spaces are representing an indentation level. The example you give makes me believe that your value fir the latter setting is 8. I still think its a BUG because I use the following settings:
Window-Preferences-Java-Editor: Appearance Tab ---------------------------------------------- Displayed Tab Width = 8
Window-Preferences-Java-Code Formatter: Style Tab ------------------------------------------------- Insert tabs for indentation, not spaces is DISABLED Number of spaces representing an indentation level = 3
I use these so that I can spot when TABS have been inserted incorrectly via other editors because the print view will be tabbed to 8 instead of 3.
BUG 28454 seems to have a patch for this - why don't you use it?
If you know that this is a dup, why aren't you marking it as one?
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 28545 *** Wrong bug #.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 28454 ***

Bug.Summery: QuickFix Import moves the current line in the window
Bug.WithStack:
When you use a QuickFix to insert an import the current line in moves down in the window. The view should shift down one line to counter that so that the current line stays at the same place on the screen.
Build 2.1-M4 Kai, is there something we can do to control this.

Bug.Summery: [resources] Can not create project with i18n name
Bug.WithStack:
Trying to create a project (or file or folder) with russian name fails with error (picture attached). The problem happens only if not Russian locale set for computer. Created attachment 3119 Error box (no log written) Created attachment 3120 Local setting used This happens if locale does not support language used. For example, with cyrrilic language and Russian or Bulgarian locales it works but with English(US) does not.
Also noted that if workspace contains projects or files named in cyrrilic they appears as not visible... for example, prjects are displayed as closed and error log contains: !MESSAGE Problems occurred while restoring the workspace. !SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 567 Jan 24, 2003 14:47:30.729 !MESSAGE The project description file (.project) for 56 is missing. This file contains important information about the project. The project will not function properly until this file is restored. !SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 567 Jan 24, 2003 14:47:30.729 !MESSAGE The project description file (.project) for 78 is missing. This file contains important information about the project. The project will not function properly until this file is restored.
I think the reason is that when eclipse writes files it uses default encoding, which is set by jvm in file.encoding property. That is wrong. Eclipse should depending on OS (if OS supports UNICODE) set encoding to UNICODE-encoding (such as UTF-8, UTF-16, USC-2 etc.) used in OS. DJ: this may have been fixed as the result of fixing bug 13463. Closing. Please re-open is this problem still occurs in build M5 or later. Thanks.

Created attachment 3119 Error box (no log written) Created attachment 3120 Local setting used This happens if locale does not support language used. For example, with cyrrilic language and Russian or Bulgarian locales it works but with English(US) does not.
Also noted that if workspace contains projects or files named in cyrrilic they appears as not visible... for example, prjects are displayed as closed and error log contains: !MESSAGE Problems occurred while restoring the workspace. !SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 567 Jan 24, 2003 14:47:30.729 !MESSAGE The project description file (.project) for 56 is missing. This file contains important information about the project. The project will not function properly until this file is restored. !SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 567 Jan 24, 2003 14:47:30.729 !MESSAGE The project description file (.project) for 78 is missing. This file contains important information about the project. The project will not function properly until this file is restored.
I think the reason is that when eclipse writes files it uses default encoding, which is set by jvm in file.encoding property. That is wrong. Eclipse should depending on OS (if OS supports UNICODE) set encoding to UNICODE-encoding (such as UTF-8, UTF-16, USC-2 etc.) used in OS. DJ: this may have been fixed as the result of fixing bug 13463. Closing. Please re-open is this problem still occurs in build M5 or later. Thanks.

Bug.Summery: QuickFix generate missing method always generate private methods [quick fix]
Bug.WithStack:
Either there should be two quickfixes, one for private and one for protected methods, or there should be a configuration option. For me, private methods is most often the wrong choice.
Build: 2.1-M4 Martin, any good idea how to solve this. Providing two quick fixes seems strange to me. We would end up providing 4. we have to avoid too many quick fixes. no plans for a preference for 2.1.
As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: [typing] Emacs style parentheses blinking
Bug.WithStack:
When typing a closing matching parenthesis (brace, bracket, ...) the corresponding opening parenthesis (brace, bracket, ...) should blink. If the opening parentheisis (brace, bracket, ...) is off the top of the editor view, the matching line should be flashed in e.g the status bar (that thing in the bottom of the Eclipse window, to the left).
It is extremely handy, esp. if you do K&R style.
Bug.WithOutStack:
When typing a closing matching parenthesis (brace, bracket, ...) the corresponding opening parenthesis (brace, bracket, ...) should blink. If the opening parentheisis (brace, bracket, ...) is off the top of the editor view, the matching line should be flashed in e.g the status bar (that thing in the bottom of the Eclipse window, to the left).
It is extremely handy, esp. if you do K&R style.

Bug.Summery: CodeAssist - no completion behind jProject
Source>Surround with try/catch does not allow refining an existing try/catch block [quick assist]
Bug.WithStack:
If you have a piece of code like this:
try{ doSomething(); doSomethingElse(); }catch(Exception e){...}
where doSomething and doSomethingElse declares some exceptions, "Source>Surround with try/catch" will not add catch clauses to the existing try/catch. You can do this using quick fix. It provides a fix add a catch block to an existing try statement.
No. QuickFixes are only available if the exception is not caught. In the example it is caught by catching the mother-of-all-exceptions. You are correct ! This is more a quick assist feature then a refactoring. Currently no action planned for 3.0 until we get external help. Reopening... This got fix a long time ago... Reopening... (worng bug) . As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.
Bug.WithOutStack:
If you have a piece of code like this:
try{ doSomething(); doSomethingElse(); }catch(Exception e){...}
where doSomething and doSomethingElse declares some exceptions, "Source>Surround with try/catch" will not add catch clauses to the existing try/catch. You can do this using quick fix. It provides a fix add a catch block to an existing try statement.
No. QuickFixes are only available if the exception is not caught. In the example it is caught by catching the mother-of-all-exceptions. You are correct ! This is more a quick assist feature then a refactoring. Currently no action planned for 3.0 until we get external help. Reopening... This got fix a long time ago... Reopening... (worng bug) . As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: StyledText - Copying text from editor does not copy font (etc)
Bug.WithStack: When copying code from the Java editor to Outlook (in HTML), colour and style is preserved, but not indentation. It works as expected when copying to Outlook in Rich text or into Word. It seems that there is only a rich text representation put into the clipboard, but no HTML representation. Copy, Cut, Paste is provided by SWT Styled Text Reassigning to SWT Inbox since OTT taking over StyledText. StyledText pastes RTF format onto clipboard which contains font info. There is no plan to copy an HTML format.
Bug.WithOutStack: When copying code from the Java editor to Outlook (in HTML), colour and style is preserved, but not indentation. It works as expected when copying to Outlook in Rich text or into Word. It seems that there is only a rich text representation put into the clipboard, but no HTML representation. Copy, Cut, Paste is provided by SWT Styled Text Reassigning to SWT Inbox since OTT taking over StyledText. StyledText pastes RTF format onto clipboard which contains font info. There is no plan to copy an HTML format.
